arm_group.description: Patients receive activated Marrow Infiltrating Lymphocytes (aMIL)
Patients do not receive activated Marrow Infiltrating Lymphocytes (aMIL)

brief_summary.textblock:
This research is being done to find out if altering the immune system by giving Prevnar
      vaccine, Tadalafil, and activated marrow infiltrating lymphocytes (MILs) can improve
      outcomes for multiple myeloma patients who receive a standard autologous stem cell
      transplant.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tadalafil and Lenalidomide Maintenance With or Without Activated Marrow Infiltrating Lymphocytes (MILs) in High Risk Myeloma

intervention.description: Patients will receive Prevnar vaccine followed by aMIL harvest. On day 0, patients will receive auto transplant followed by Tadalafil and aMIL. At day 60, patients will receive Lenalidomide.
Patients will receive Prevnar vaccine followed by aMIL harvest. On day 0, patients will receive auto transplant followed by Tadalafil. At day 60, patients will receive Lenalidomide.

facility.name: Sidney Kimmel Comprehensive Cancer Center at Johns Hopkins

clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Phase II Study of Autologous Stem Cell Transplantation With Tadalafil and Lenalidomide Maintenance With or Without Activated Marrow Infiltrating Lymphocytes (MILs) in High Risk Myeloma

authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Determine the efficacy of Activated Marrow Infiltrating Lymphocytes (MILs) in prolonging progression free survival (PFS) in patients with high risk multiple myeloma followed by Autologous Stem Cell Transplantation (ASCT).

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events related to the infusion of  activated MILs will be collected.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
